name: Recognizing Manipulative Social Structures
description: Identifying the red flags of toxic social environments and power imbalances before they become dangerous.

cards.title: The Illusion of Consensus
cards.description: Understanding how manipulators manufacture agreement to reinforce control.
bulletpoints: PSNs manipulate group dynamics to create the illusion of universal agreement.
Challenging false consensus by privately surveying individual beliefs disrupts control.
Recognizing when silence is compliance rather than genuine agreement is crucial.
cards.summaryText: Catch how PSNs fake unanimous agreement to lock in control, challenge it by quietly asking people one-on-one what they really think, and spot the difference between real agreement and just staying silent.

cards.title: The Emotional Leash
cards.description: Detecting and breaking emotional dependencies created by toxic groups or individuals.
bulletpoints: PSNs create emotional highs and lows to maintain psychological control.
Recognizing when your emotional state is dictated by an external source is key.
Breaking free involves rebuilding self-validation mechanisms independent of the group.
cards.summaryText: Notice how they manufacture emotional roller coasters to keep you hooked, recognize when someone else is pulling your emotional strings, and break free by learning to validate yourself without them.

cards.title: Social Pyramid Schemes of Control
cards.description: Understanding how manipulative social hierarchies keep members trapped.
bulletpoints: PSNs construct multi-tiered influence structures to isolate members from reality.
Identifying 'gatekeepers' who reinforce dependency can provide an exit strategy.
Disrupting the hierarchy often starts with removing oneself from key influence loops.
cards.summaryText: Understand how they build layered control pyramids that cut members off from reality, spot the gatekeepers who enforce dependency to find your way out, and break the hierarchy by stepping out of the influence loops.
